revised_title: High-Resolution Electron Microscope Study of Martensite and Martensitic Interfaces in Titanium-Manganese Alloy
tldr: This study uses high-resolution transmission electron microscopy to analyze the martensitic transformation in a titanium-manganese alloy. The research provides two-dimensional lattice fringe images of the parent-martensite interface and reveals the existence of atomic-scale steps in the internal martensite twin interfaces. The findings suggest an explanation for the fine striated substructure of the martensite and contribute to the understanding of the fine-scale structure of interfaces.
